claims.claim: Data-driven machine learning has emerged as a promising approach for building accurate and robust statistical models from medical data.
claims.evidence: Data-driven machine learning (ML) has emerged as a promising approach for building accurate and robust statistical models from medical data,

claims.claim: Existing medical data is not fully exploited by ML primarily because it sits in data silos and privacy concerns restrict access to this data.
claims.evidence: Existing medical data is not fully exploited by ML primarily because it sits in data silos and privacy concerns restrict access to this data.

claims.claim: Federated learning (FL) enables gaining insights collaboratively without moving patient data beyond the firewalls of the institutions in which they reside.
claims.evidence: FL enables gaining insights collaboratively, e.g., in the form of a consensus model, without moving patient data beyond the firewalls of the institutions in which they reside.

claims.claim: Models trained by FL can achieve performance levels comparable to ones trained on centrally hosted data sets and superior to models that only see isolated single-institutional data.
claims.evidence: Recent research has shown that models trained by FL can achieve performance levels comparable to ones trained on centrally hosted data sets and superior to models that only see isolated single-institutional data

claims.claim: A successful implementation of FL could hold a significant potential for enabling precision medicine at large-scale, leading to models that yield unbiased decisions, optimally reflect an individual’s physiology, and are sensitive to rare diseases while respecting governance and privacy concerns.
claims.evidence: A successful implementation of FL could thus hold a significant potential for enabling precision medicine at large-scale, leading to models that yield unbiased decisions, optimally reflect an individual’s physiology, and are sensitive to rare diseases while respecting governance and privacy concerns.

claims.claim: WHO has a presence in countries
WHO has a data collection system
Data mining combines statistics and artificial intelligence to analyze large datasets to discover meaningful insights and useful information.
claims.evidence: Learn how data mining combines statistics and artificial intelligence to analyze large datasets to discover meaningful insights and useful information.

claims.claim: Chatbots simulate human conversation, often relying on NLP to parse inputs and generative AI to automate responses.
claims.evidence: Explore chatbot technology to understand how chatbots simulate human conversation, often relying on NLP to parse inputs and generative AI to automate responses.

claims.claim: Business intelligence processes data to gain actionable insights and inform decision-making.
claims.evidence: Know how to harness business data by understanding how business intelligence processes data to gain actionable insights and inform decision-making.

claims.claim: Artificial intelligence (AI) will increasingly be applied within the field of healthcare.
claims.evidence: The complexity and rise of data in healthcare means that artificial intelligence (AI) will increasingly be applied within the field.

claims.claim: Several types of AI are already being employed by payers and providers of care, and life sciences companies.
claims.evidence: Several types of AI are already being employed by payers and providers of care, and life sciences companies.

claims.claim: Deep learning is increasingly being applied to radiomics, or the detection of clinically relevant features in imaging data beyond what can be perceived by the human eye.
claims.evidence: Deep learning is increasingly being applied to radiomics, or the detection of clinically relevant features in imaging data beyond what can be perceived by the human eye.

claims.claim: Implementation factors will prevent large-scale automation of healthcare professional jobs for a considerable period.
claims.evidence: Although there are many instances in which AI can perform healthcare tasks as well or better than humans, implementation factors will prevent large-scale automation of healthcare professional jobs for a considerable period.
